abstract: International Airlines Group, parent company of British Airways, says profit rose by 81 percent in 2014; operating profit was 1.39 billion euros, or $1.57 billion, on revenue of greater than 20 billion euros; net profit surged to 1 billion euros, from 527 million euros year earlier.
lead_paragraph: Performance was bolstered by strong passenger demand on trans-Atlantic routes and a turnaround at the Spanish carrier Iberia.

headline.main: Annual Profit Surges for I.A.G., Parent of British Airways
headline.print_headline: Profit Increases 81% at Parent of British Airways

snippet: Performance was bolstered by strong passenger demand on trans-Atlantic routes and a turnaround at the Spanish carrier Iberia.
